headline.main: French Open Champion Labours to Three-Set Win
headline.print_headline: French Open Champion Labours to Three-Set Win

docs.snippet: French Open champion Garbine Muguruza said she had to play ugly on Monday to negotiate Wimbledon's perilous grass courts and a dangerous opponent....
docs.lead_paragraph: French Open champion Garbine Muguruza said she had to play ugly on Monday to negotiate Wimbledon's perilous grass courts and a dangerous opponent.

headline.main: French Open Champion Labors to Three-Set Defeat of Giorgi
headline.print_headline: French Open Champion Labors to Three-Set Defeat of Giorgi

docs.snippet: French Open champion Garbine Muguruza had to work hard to transfer her punch on Paris clay to Wimbledon's grass on Monday, beating Camila Giorgi 6-2 5-7 6-4 with a performance of powerful baseline tennis....
docs.lead_paragraph: French Open champion Garbine Muguruza had to work hard to transfer her punch on Paris clay to Wimbledon's grass on Monday, beating Camila Giorgi 6-2 5-7 6-4 with a performance of powerful baseline tennis.

headline.main: Los Angeles Undersheriff Gets 5 Years in Corruption Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Undersheriff Gets 5 Years in Corruption Inquiry

docs.snippet: The former second-in-command of the nation's largest sheriff's department was sentenced Monday to five years in prison in a federal corruption investigation that also brought down his boss and 19 other members of the department....
docs.lead_paragraph: The former second-in-command of the nation's largest sheriff's department was sentenced Monday to five years in prison in a federal corruption investigation that also brought down his boss and 19 other members of the department.

headline.main: Kerry Sees Britain's Global Standing Changed, Not Diminished, by Brexit
headline.print_headline: Kerry Sees Britain's Global Standing Changed, Not Diminished, by Brexit

docs.snippet: Britain's decision to leave the European Union has changed its global standing rather than diminished it, U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday, but he added he will "regret" Britain's absence in U.S.-EU negotiations....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's decision to leave the European Union has changed its global standing rather than diminished it, U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday, but he added he will "regret" Britain's absence in U.S.-EU negotiations.

headline.main: Syria's HNC Urges EU Sanctions to Push Russia Onto Peace Track
headline.print_headline: Syria's HNC Urges EU Sanctions to Push Russia Onto Peace Track

docs.snippet: Syria's main opposition group said on Monday the European Union should impose targeted sanctions on Russian companies supporting the war in Syria as it sought to consolidate its position before a potential new round of peace talks in Geneva next m...
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's main opposition group said on Monday the European Union should impose targeted sanctions on Russian companies supporting the war in Syria as it sought to consolidate its position before a potential new round of peace talks in Geneva next month.

headline.main: Welsh Nationalists to Intensify Push for Independence After Brexit
headline.print_headline: Welsh Nationalists to Intensify Push for Independence After Brexit

docs.snippet: The nationalist party of Wales will intensify its push for independence in response to last week's decision by British voters to leave the European Union, the head of the party said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nationalist party of Wales will intensify its push for independence in response to last week's decision by British voters to leave the European Union, the head of the party said on Monday.

headline.main: Baseline Maestro Nishikori Subdues Groth in Clash of Styles
headline.print_headline: Baseline Maestro Nishikori Subdues Groth in Clash of Styles

docs.snippet: Japan's Kei Nishikori produced a fine display of hard hitting from the baseline to subdue Australia's Sam Groth 6-4 6-3 7-5 in an entertaining clash of styles in the Wimbledon first round on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japan's Kei Nishikori produced a fine display of hard hitting from the baseline to subdue Australia's Sam Groth 6-4 6-3 7-5 in an entertaining clash of styles in the Wimbledon first round on Monday.

headline.main: Study: Trump Budget, Tax Plans Add at Least $10T to Debt
headline.print_headline: Study: Trump Budget, Tax Plans Add at Least $10T to Debt

docs.snippet: A new Washington study says Donald Trump's tax and budget plans would make the national debt skyrocket by $10 trillion or more over the coming decade, mostly because of his ambitious and expensive tax cuts....
docs.lead_paragraph: A new Washington study says Donald Trump's tax and budget plans would make the national debt skyrocket by $10 trillion or more over the coming decade, mostly because of his ambitious and expensive tax cuts.

headline.main: Europe Is Strong, Needs to Be More 'Caring' in Future: Italy's Renzi
headline.print_headline: Europe Is Strong, Needs to Be More 'Caring' in Future: Italy's Renzi

docs.snippet: Europe is strong and solid even after Britain voted to leave the bloc's economic and political union, but needs to take a more "caring" approach in the future, Italian prime minister Matteo Renzi said on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Europe is strong and solid even after Britain voted to leave the bloc's economic and political union, but needs to take a more "caring" approach in the future, Italian prime minister Matteo Renzi said on Monday.

headline.main: Two-Thirds Say Obama Tried to Make Race Relations Better
headline.print_headline: Two-Thirds Say Obama Tried to Make Race Relations Better

docs.snippet: Almost eight years after electing a black president, vast majorities of blacks and Hispanics think President Barack Obama at least tried to make race relations in the United States better, according to a poll released Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost eight years after electing a black president, vast majorities of blacks and Hispanics think President Barack Obama at least tried to make race relations in the United States better, according to a poll released Monday.
